text: Question about homework 1. What do you use for the initial value in the simulation? Average of those three drilling costs in 2006?
I am pretty sure you are right

Somewhat confused by that as well.  So we really have 16 rows in the end right?  The homework makes it sound like we should have 48.

"Instead of focusing on costs for oil, gas, and dry wells individually, the Company’s
analysts recommend to treat them all equally and assume an average cost applies to
them all. (HINT: You should have 48 observations. Geometric changes from 1991 –
2006.)"

Hey Ryan, that's what I thought too but I checked with labarr and he said just treat all 48 as individual obs. That is, ignore that they are associated  with years and commodities and pretend it was just a list of 48 percentage change values.
<@U1N43E3E0> basically its 16x3. you want a mean and sd from these values for the normal distribution simulation. for the kde, you use these 48 raw values as the input
For the record, they aren't straight up percentage changes
There's a natural log involved.  Click on one of the boxes and look at the formula bar.
does he want us to account for that?
I think the geometric change is an estimate of the normal percent change so I just treated them as normal percent changes
I spoke to him today and he didnt mention that at all
the prompt says open to suggestions - i have none :joy: same here <@U1NUU2U9E>
Well in any case thanks <@U1KT9ATA5>  and <@U1L914KNJ> I was definitely going down the wrong path with that
phew thanks john i was confused as to why it wasn't the true percent change
